intro: Scutellaria anhweiensis var. fanchangnica, commonly known as the Fanchangnica skullcap, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
